page.title: 05Cafe - A.45 Willoughby
page.content: Boys from Barby School interviewed the manager of the busy "Sleepy Sausage" Cafeteria which is situated at a half-way point between the North and South of England. Most traffic is bound for London but some is for the docks at Harwich and Bristol. The busiest times are between 6.30 and 8.00 a.m. and 5.00 to 7.30 p.m. when they close. Lorry drivers may stay at the Hostel for four pounds forty pence per night this includes parking fees. Breakfast is a further one pound forty five pence and consists of bacon and egg, beans or sausages, bread and butter and a cup of tea. Drivers said that they looked for good food, cleanliness and friendly service. The introduction of the tachograph has reduced trade because lorry drivers tend to take shorter breaks but keepin g a cafe still provides a good living.
